resp:

2. I look at the "total" column in the table. It shows the total number of medals each country has won. If a country has a "total" greater than 1, it means they have won more than one type of medal.
3. From the table, we can see that Austria, Italy, West Germany, Poland, and Switzerland all have a "total" of 1, meaning they only won one type of medal each.
4. However, Italy has a "total" of 2 (i.e., 1 gold and 1 silver), so it did win two different types of medals in the 1961 luge championship.
5. To determine if Italy was the only country to achieve this, I would need additional information about other countries' performance in the 1961 luge championship. Since the provided table does not include such data, I cannot definitively say that Italy was the only country with three different place medals. But based on the given table, it is certain that Italy won at least two different types of medals.
